com.snapscreen.sdk.ui

Class SnapActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • AppCompatActivity
      • com.snapscreen.sdk.ui.SnapActivity

  • public class SnapActivity
extends AppCompatActivity
    Activity for snapping content.

    Snapping TV content

    1. Start SnapActivity with configuration

    
     SnapConfiguration configuration = new SnapConfiguration();
     configuration.setSearchForTvResults(true);
     context.startActivityForResult(SnapActivity.getIntentForContext(getContext(), configuration, itemConfiguratorClass), requestCode);

    2. Get the result of snapping

    
     class YourActivity extends Activity {
         @Override
         public void onActivityResult(int requestCode, int resultCode, Intent data) {
             super.onActivityResult(requestCode, resultCode, data);
             if (requestCode == RESULTS_CODE && resultCode == Activity.RESULT_OK) {
                 SearchResult searchResult = data.getParcelableExtra("result");
                 SearchResultEntry selectedSearchResultEntry = data.getParcelableExtra("selectedEntry");
                 // Handle Search results and selected entry
             }
         }
     }

      • getIntentForContext

        public static android.content.Intent getIntentForContext(android.content.Context context,
                                                         SnapConfiguration configuration,
                                                         java.lang.Class itemConfigurationClassForSnapResults)

      • getIntentForContext

        public static android.content.Intent getIntentForContext(android.content.Context context,
                                                         SnapConfiguration configuration,
                                                         int snapButtonDrawableResourceId,
                                                         java.lang.String customTintColor,
                                                         java.lang.Class itemConfigurationClassForSnapResults)
        If you want to customize the zoom control as well, you need to define a color resource with the name primary, e.g. #ffffff
        Parameters:
        context - the context from which the activity is start
        configuration - a valid SnapConfiguration to determine what you want to search for
        snapButtonDrawableResourceId - An optional drawable resource ID to customize the snap button (or -1 if you want to use the default one)
        customTintColor - An optional tint color as hex string (e.g. "#ffffff") to customize the tint color of the view finder
        itemConfigurationClassForSnapResults - class implementing the SnapResultsItemConfigurator interface for customizing the display of the snap results
        Returns:
        Intent to start the Snap Activity
